text: Culver Griffin is 91 years old he
started square dancing as a teenager in
1946 he was introduced to the art of
calling the dance steps and he's been
doing it ever since every spring his
voice fills the barn at the annual
square dance in garrison New York when I
was in high school I used to hitchhike
to Vermont where my aunt at a summer
place there was a square dance every
Saturday night some of the farm boys
came directly from the milking shed
boots and all that's when I started
dancing no I didn't start calling until
late in life I was 30
so what's your secret my secret is I
haven't died yet myself and I've danced
for 60 75 years so I've got my own knees
and my own hips do you think the damn
thing helps it must him that means I've
been calling 62 years I would be right
and I'm just going to go on doing it
that's all
Oh
